meanings.definition: To release or reduce pressure or tension
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, I decompressed by taking a relaxing bath.
meanings.sent2: The scuba diver needed to decompress slowly after resurfacing from a deep dive.
meanings.sent3: The balloon decompressed with a loud pop, startling everyone nearby.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter decompressed the tense atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The stress of the exam decompressed as soon as it was over.

meanings.definition: To restore to a normal or uncompressed state
meanings.sent1: The computer technician decompressed the file to its original size.
meanings.sent2: The memory foam pillow decompressed after being unpacked from its vacuum-sealed packaging.
meanings.sent3: The spring decompressed and sprung back into shape after being compressed in the machine.
meanings.sent4: His heart decompressed with relief when he found his lost wallet.
meanings.sent5: The sponge decompressed as it absorbed water, returning to its fluffy state.
